content: knitting club flat hat designed by jennifer stover this is a great beginner hat knit flat that will have you knit and purl on the same row increase decrease and seam this hat is sized for an 18 20 head but can be adjusted by increasing or decreasing co sts in amounts of 4 note larger size is in parenthesis highlight correct pattern marking to follow the size intended gauge is 4sts x 6 row = 1 materials  tape measure or ruler  worsted weight yarn  darning needle for seaming  straight us 8 needles terminology  co cast on  kfb knit into the front and back of the same  st s stitch es stitch increasing stitch count by one  rs right side row  k2tog knit two stitches together decreasing  ws wrong side row stitch count by one  k knit  * * repeat directions between * * until one  p purl stitch remains directions co 74 82 sts ribbing row 1 rs k1 * k2 p2 * p1 repeat this row 7 more times hat body row 9 rs k1 * k8 9 kfb * k1 82 90 sts on needle row 10 ws purl row 11 rs knit repeat row 10 & 11 until hat measures 6 from beginning ending your last row with a ws row if you want to make a slouchy hat knit for 2 -4 longer depending on how slouchy you would like it crown decrease row 1 rs k1 * k8 9 k2tog * k1 74 82 sts remain row 13 k1 * k2 3 k2tog * k1 26 34 sts remain row 2 purl row 14 purl row 3 k1 * k7 8 k2tog * k1 66 74 sts remain row 15 k1 * k1 2 k2tog * k1 18 26 sts remain row 4 purl row 16 purl row 5 k1 * k6 7 k2tog * k1 58 66 sts remain ** note for 18 size skip to row 19 ** row 6 purl row 17 k1 * k1 k2tog * k1 18 sts remain row 7 k1 * k5 6 k2tog * k1 50 58 sts remain row 18 purl row 8 purl row 19 k1 * k2tog * k1 10 sts remain row 9 k1 * k4 5 k2tog * k1 42 50 sts remain row 10 purl break yarn leaving 12 tail use needle & weave yarn row 11 k1 * k3 4 k2tog * k1 34 42 sts remain through remaining 10 stitches seam side of hat weave row 12 purl in beginning and ends of yarn cut remaining yarn
